title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, collaborators pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement contain maintainer, package developer post issue. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to embrs
text: outlines propose change embrs. text based template provided folks developed tidyverse packages. Please see tidy contributing guide contributions packages, good practices contributing open software, data sets archives generally.

title: Contributing to embrs
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface pull request (see ). Documentation generated using roxygen2, need edit comments roxygen2 comments section related .R script, rather discrete .Rd file. (associated .Rd file built .R using devtools::document().)

title: Contributing to embrs
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone project team agrees ’s needed don’t hinder established user work-flows. , please note, major changes main functions may possible many take time test implement. Likewise, ’ve found bug, please file issue. like illustrate bug minimal reprex example may ask problems replicated non-reprex bug reports, appreciate ‘head-’ regardless format think anything behaving…

title: Contributing to embrs
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , tidyverse folks recommend using usethis::create_from_github("karlropkins/embrs", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea get contact continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). tidyverse recommendation use usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR (tidyverse recommendation usethis::pr_push() tehn follow prompts browser). Ideally, title PR briefly describe change, body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, please include suggestion NEWS.Rmd bullet.

title: Contributing to embrs
text: Please feel free follow tidyverse style guide regarding coding practices format, works can understand , going waste anyone’s time enforcing specific coding practices. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. require also . currently use testthat unit tests. appreciate worked examples demonstrating code modification , please, testthat.

title: Contributing to embrs
text: Please note embrs project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: R Package
text: can install development version embrs GitHub :

title: R Package
text: embrs uses vehicle route objects build small-scale emission inventories:
code: library(embrs) # some buses # a ICE diesel bus weighing 15925 kg bus.1 <- bus_ice(name="E6DV", veh.wt=15925)  # a battery electric bus weighing 17725 kg (and conventional brakes)  bus.2 <- bus_bev(name="BEV", veh.wt=17725)  # like bus.2 but with regenerative brakes operating at 25% efficiency bus.3 <- bus_bev(name="BEV\nlow", veh.wt=17725, brk.regen = 0.25)  # like bus.3 but 75% efficiency bus.4 <- bus_bev(name="BEV\nhi", veh.wt=17725, brk.regen = 0.75)   # a small fleet fleet <- bus.1 + bus.2 + bus.3 + bus.4 # some routes  routes <- route_naei_urban() + route_naei_rural() + route_naei_motorway() # an inventory inventory <- fleet * routes plot(inventory)

title: bus objects — bus.objets
text: veh.wt (required numeric) weight vehicle kg. n (numeric) number vehicles, defualt 1. name (character) name vehicle object. ... arguments, currently ignored

title: Beddows Non-Exhaust Emissions Factors — ef_beddows
text: Functions estimated vehicle weight-based non-exhaust PM2.5 PM10 emission factors based methods Beddows.

title: Beddows Non-Exhaust Emissions Factors — ef_beddows
code: ef_beddows_nee_pm(   veh.wt,   em.type = c("pm2.5", "pm10"),   em.source = c("brake", "tyre", "road", "resusp"),   brk.regen = FALSE,   route.def = c("urban", "rural", "motorway"),   route.source = "uk naei",   verbose = FALSE,   ... )  ef_beddows_brake_pm2.5(em.type, em.source, ...)  ef_beddows_brake_pm10(em.type, em.source, ...)  ef_beddows_tyre_pm2.5(em.type, em.source, ...)  ef_beddows_tyre_pm10(em.type, em.source, ...)  ef_beddows_road_pm2.5(em.type, em.source, ...)  ef_beddows_road_pm10(em.type, em.source, ...)  ef_beddows_resusp_pm2.5(em.type, em.source, ...)  ef_beddows_resusp_pm10(em.type, em.source, ...)

title: Beddows Non-Exhaust Emissions Factors — ef_beddows
text: veh.wt (numeric, required) vehicle weight (kg). em.type (character) type emissions predict, default PM2.5 PM10. em.source (character) emission source, default brake, tyre, road resuspension, can combination. brk.regen vehicle regenerative braking, default FALSE means installed/used numeric (0-1) efficiency installed/used, e.g. 0.25 = 25% efficient (equivalent 75% conventional non-regenerative brake contribution). route.def (character) route definitions, default urban, rural motorway. route.source (character) route sources, must UK NAEI. ... arguments, often passed .

title: Beddows Non-Exhaust Emissions Factors — ef_beddows
text: functions build data.frames urban, rural motorway emission factors non-exhaust PM2.5 PM10. ef_beddows_nee_pm main function, others wrappers single soucre type emissions factors.

title: Beddows Non-Exhaust Emissions Factors — ef_beddows
text: may moving vein point...

title: Beddows Non-Exhaust Emissions Factors — ef_beddows
text: functions based methods developed reported : Beddows, D.C. Harrison, R.M., 2021. PM10 PM2. 5 emission factors non-exhaust particles road vehicles: Dependence upon vehicle mass implications battery electric vehicles. Atmospheric Environment, 244, p.117886. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.atmosenv.2020.117886

title: Version 0.0 - Release Notes
text: built basic package using grey.area [2022-09-21] added ef_beddows functions (basic methods beddows paper) [2022-09-21] added ef_embrs functions (basic methods bus paper) [2022-09-21] first draft embrs object classes [2022-12-09] revised embrs object classes (ops handling) [2022-12-11] first draft embrs object docs [2022-12-12] website skeleton build [2022-12-12] object tidying (print.embrs output) [2022-12-13] object handling revision [2022-12-13] website update, updated description (web links) [2022-12-13] website update, added coc contribution [2022-12-13] website update, coc links (minor fixes) [2022-12-14] website update, news update [2022-12-14]
